intro: Erodium pulverulentum subsp. bovei, commonly known as the Bove's hairy erodium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas. It produces small, hairy seeds that are dispersed by wind, contributing to its ability to colonize new areas. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly larger leaves and more robust growth compared to other members of the species.
